removals.reasoning: Parentheses around the array index are redundant; the index expression i * ni + j parses correctly without them and removing them improves readability.
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary; B[i * nk + j] is equivalent and clearer.
Redundant parentheses around the index expression; removing them does not change meaning.
Index parentheses are unnecessary; D[i * nm + j] is equivalent and simpler.
Parentheses around a single index expression are redundant and can be removed for readability.
Removing the outer parentheses around the index does not change semantics and improves clarity.
Unnecessary parentheses around the index expression; G[i * ni + j] is clearer.
The inner parentheses around (num + factor) are redundant. Keep a single pair to group the numerator for the division: (num + factor - 1) / factor.
No parentheses to remove in this exact line; reported earlier as potential, but it's already written without redundant parentheses.

removals.expression: dot = (dot + (A[(i * nk + k)] * B[(k * nj + j)]));
removals.replacement: dot = dot + (A[i * nk + k] * B[k * nj + j]);
removals.reasoning: Outer parentheses around the entire RHS are redundant. Also remove the array-index parentheses (A[(...)] and B[(...)]) — the product grouping may be kept for clarity but the extra outer parens are unnecessary.
Array-index parentheses are redundant; writing C[i * nj + j] is equivalent and clearer.
Parentheses around a simple constant arithmetic expression are unnecessary; removing them is clearer.
The outer pair of parentheses is redundant. For a cast of an address, (uint8_t*)&temp_grid_copy1 is conventional and clearer than ((uint8_t*)(&temp_grid_copy1)).
Remove the redundant outer parentheses; the cast syntax (uint8_t*)&grid is equivalent and more concise.
Unnecessary extra parentheses around the cast operand; simplifying improves readability without changing behavior.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant; the simpler form is equivalent.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the casted &expression.
Same pattern as earlier memcpy calls: outer parentheses around the casted pointer are redundant.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast; (uint8_t*)&grid is clearer.
Unnecessary parentheses around the casted address; safe to remove.
Outer parentheses are redundant and can be removed for clarity.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast of the address.
As above, the extra parentheses are unnecessary.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast can be removed.
The outer parentheses around the cast provide no semantic effect and can be removed.
The outer parentheses wrapping the cast are redundant in a function-call argument; (double*)A is sufficient and clearer.
Remove unnecessary outer parentheses around the cast.
Outer parentheses around the casted pointer are redundant in the call site.
Simplify the cast expression by removing an unnecessary outer pair of parentheses.
The extra outer parentheses add no value and can be removed.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast in the argument list.
Same as above.
Outer parentheses around the cast in a function-call argument are unnecessary.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast.
Simplify the argument by removing extra parentheses.
Outer parentheses around the cast are redundant.
Unnecessary outer parentheses can be removed without changing semantics.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses around the casted pointer.
Same redundant outer parentheses removal as other arguments.
The outer parentheses around the cast argument to print_array are unnecessary.
The outermost parentheses are redundant around the cast-expression passed to free(); leaving the casts intact keeps the code correct and clearer.
Remove the redundant outer parentheses surrounding the cast expression.
Outer parentheses around the cast passed to free() are not needed.
Simplify by dropping the redundant outer pair of parentheses.
Remove unnecessary outer parentheses in the free() call.
The outermost parentheses add no semantic value and can be removed.
As above, the outermost parentheses are redundant in this free() call.
Parentheses around a single variable in an argument list are unnecessary; passing the variable directly is clearer.
Remove redundant parentheses around the array index expression; this is the same pattern as other array-index removals.
Parentheses around the single variable newline_str are unnecessary when used as a function argument.
